paper_abstract: The concept of glocal memory (i e memory involving systematic coordination between localized memory traces and globalized dynamical-attractor-based memory traces) is reviewed and is argued to be a critical principle for the design of artificial brains and artificial general intelligence systems Some exploratory experiments are reviewed involving introduction of glocal memory into Hopfield neural networks and also Into economic attention networks as utilized in the OpenCog and Novamente integrated AI architectures (C) 2010 Elsevier B V All rights reserved
paper_title: Glocal memory A critical design principle for artificial brains and minds
